Question Text: let's start with your general view about the current direction of our country. some people might think the country is going in the wrong direction. others may feel it is going in the right direction. so let me ask you about the overall direction of the country: would you say that the country is going in the wrong direction or going in the right direction
    Variable Label: ''
    Question Text: ''

Question Number: Q19A
Variable Label: Q19a. Government bans organizations vs. join any
Question Text: which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.  statement 1: the government should be able to ban any organization that goes against its policies. statement 2: we should be able to join any organization, whether or not the government approves of it
    Variable Label: ''
    Question Text: ''

Question Number: Q19B
Variable Label: Q19b. Media free to publish vs. government control
Question Text: which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2. statement 1: the media should have the right to publish any views and ideas without government control. statement 2: the government should have the right to prevent the media from publishing things that it disapproves of
    Variable Label: ''
    Question Text: ''

Question Number: Q20A
Variable Label: Q20a. Reject one-party rule
Question Text: there are many ways to govern a country. would you disapprove or approve of the following alternatives: only one political party is allowed to stand for election and hold office
    Variable Label: ''
    Question Text: ''

Variable Label: Q20b. Reject military rule

    Question Text: ''

Question Number: Q20C
Variable Label: Q20c. Reject one-man rule.
Question Text: there are many ways to govern a country. would you disapprove or approve of the following alternatives: elections and parliament are abolished so that the president can decide everything
    Variable Label: ''
    Question Text: ''

Question Number: Q21
Variable Label: Q21. Support for democracy
Question Text: which of these three statements is closest to your own opinion?  statement 1: democracy is preferable to any other kind of government statement 2: in some circumstances, a non-democratic government can be preferable. statement 3: for someone like me, it doesn’t matter what kind of government we have
    Variable Label: ''
    Question Text: ''

Question Number: Q22
Variable Label: Q22. Govt gets things done vs. govt accountable to citizens
Question Text: which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.  statement 1: it is more important to have a government that can get things done, even if we have no influence over what it does. statement 2: it is more important for citizens to be able to hold government accountable, even if that means it makes decisions more slowly
    Variable Label: ''
    Question Text: ''

Question Number: Q23
Variable Label: Q23 Listen to wisdom of elders vs. fresh ideas from young people
Question Text: which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.  statement 1: in order for our country to do well, we should listen more to the wisdom of our elders. statement 2: in order for our country to do well, we should listen more to fresh ideas from young people
    Variable Label: ''
    Question Text: ''

Question Number: Q24
Variable Label: Q24. Choose leaders through elections vs. other methods
Question Text: which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.  statement 1: we should choose our leaders in this country through regular, open and honest elections. statement 2: since elections sometimes produce bad results, we should adopt other methods for choosing this country’s leaders
    Variable Label: ''
    Question Text: ''

Question Number: Q25
Variable Label: Q25. Political parties divisive vs. many parties needed
Question Text: which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.   statement 1: political parties create division and confusion; it is therefore unnecessary to have many political parties in sierra leone. statement 2: many political parties are needed to make sure that sierra leone have real choices in who governs them
    Variable Label: ''
    Question Text: ''

Question Number: Q26
Variable Label: Q26.  Elected officials follow constituent demands vs follow own ideas
Question Text: which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2 statement 1: our elected officials should listen to constituents’ views and do what they demand. statement 2: our elected leaders should follow their own ideas in deciding what is best for the country
    Variable Label: ''
    Question Text: ''

Question Number: Q27
Variable Label: Q27. Elected leaders empower most capable vs help people left behind
Question Text: which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2 statement 1: our elected leaders need to focus on empowering our most capable citizens. statement 2: our elected leaders should focus on helping people who have been left behind by economic and social change
    Variable Label: ''
    Question Text: ''

Question Number: Q28
Variable Label: Q28. Experts make most important decisions vs no need for experts
Question Text: which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2 statement 1: experts with specialized education or skills are needed to help make the most important decisions for our country. statement 2: the people and their elected representatives know what is best; they do not need the advice of experts to run the country
    Variable Label: ''
    Question Text: ''

Question Number: Q29
Variable Label: Q29. President monitored by parliament vs. free to act on own
Question Text: which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2 statement 1: parliament should ensure that the president explains to it on a regular basis how his government spends taxpayers’ money. statement 2: the president should be able to devote his full attention to developing the country rather than wasting time justifying his actions
    Variable Label: ''
    Question Text: ''

Question Number: Q30
Variable Label: Q30. President free to act vs. obey the laws and courts
Question Text: which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.  statement 1: since the president was elected to lead the country, he should not be bound by laws or court decisions that he thinks are wrong.  statement 2: the president must always obey the laws and the courts, even if he thinks they are wrong
    Variable Label: ''
    Question Text: ''

Question Number: Q31
Variable Label: Q31. Election winner pursues preferred policies vs. compromise w/others
Question Text: which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.  statement 1: whichever party or group wins elections should be able to pursue the policies they prefer, without needing to compromise with others. statement 2: in a democracy, it is important to make compromises between the preferences and needs of different group
    Variable Label: ''
    Question Text: ''

Question Number: Q32
Variable Label: Q32. Popular govt free to do whatever people want vs always follow the law
Question Text: which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.  statement 1: a government that enjoys the support of the people should be free to do whatever the people want, even if it is outside the law. statement 2: the actions of any government, no matter how popular it is, must always follow the law
    Variable Label: ''
    Question Text: ''

Question Number: Q33
Variable Label: Q33. Media checks government vs. avoid negative reporting
Question Text: which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.  statement 1: the news media should constantly investigate and report on government mistakes and corruption. statement 2: too much reporting on negative events, like government mistakes and corruption, only harms the country
    Variable Label: ''
    Question Text: ''

Question Number: Q34
Variable Label: Q34. Presidential two term limit vs. no term limits
Question Text: which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2 statement 1: the constitution should limit the president to serving a maximum of two terms in office. statement 2: there should be no constitutional limit on how long the president can serve
    Variable Label: ''
    Question Text: ''

Question Number: Q36

Question Number: Q59E
Variable Label: Q59e. Social media: makes people more intolerant.
Question Text: regardless of whether you personally use social media yourself, please tell me whether you agree or disagree that social media: makes people more intolerant of those who have different political opinions
    Variable Label: ''
    Question Text: ''

Question Number: Q59F
Variable Label: Q59f. Effects of social media on society
Question Text: overall, do you think that the effects of social media on society are mostly positive, mostly negative, or haven’t you heard enough to say
    Variable Label: ''
    Question Text: ''

Question Number: Q60
Variable Label: Q60. Unrestricted access to the Internet vs regulated access
Question Text: which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2. statement 1: unrestricted access to the internet and social media helps people to be more informed and active citizens and should be protected. statement 2: information shared on the internet and social media is dividing sierra leoneans, so access should be regulated by government
    Variable Label: ''
    Question Text: ''

Question Number: Q61
Variable Label: Q61. Allow free movement in region vs limit cross-border movement
Question Text: now let’s talk about how our country should relate to other countries in west africa and the world. which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2. statement 1: people living in west africa should be able to move freely across international borders in order to trade or work in other countries. statement 2: in order to protect their own citizens, governments should limit the cross-border movement of people and goods
    Variable Label: ''
    Question Text: ''

Question Number: Q62
Variable Label: Q62. Difficulty to move across borders
Question Text: in your opinion, how easy or difficult is it for people in west africa to cross international borders in order to work or trade in other countries, or haven’t you heard enough to say
    Variable Label: ''
    Question Text: ''

Question Number: Q63
Variable Label: Q63. Finance development from own resources vs use external loans.
Question Text: which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2. statement 1: it is important that as an independent nation, we finance development from our own resources, even if it means paying more taxes. statement 2: we should use external loans for the development of the country, even if it increases our indebtedness to foreign countries and institutions
    Variable Label: ''
    Question Text: ''

Question Number: Q64A
Variable Label: Q64a. Strict spending requirements on external loans vs govt decides
Question Text: which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2. statement 1: when other countries give loans or development assistance to sierra leone, they should enforce strict requirements on how the funds are spent. statement 2: when other countries give sierra leone loans or development assistance, they should allow our government to make its own decisions about how to use the resources
    Variable Label: ''
    Question Text: ''

Question Number: Q64B
Variable Label: Q64b. Strict democracy conditions on external loans vs govt decides
Question Text: which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2. statement 1: when other countries give loans or development assistance to sierra leone, they should enforce strict requirements to make sure our government promotes democracy and respects human rights.           statement 2: even if other countries give sierra leone loans or development assistance, our government should make its own decisions about democracy and human rights
    Variable Label: ''
    Question Text: ''

Question Number: Q66
Variable Label: Q66. Open trade for development vs protection of local producers.
Question Text: which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2. statement 1: in order to develop, our country must rely on trade with the rest of the world, including by opening our borders to foreign imports. statement 2: in order to develop, our country must rely on local production and protect local producers from foreign competition
    Variable Label: ''
    Question Text: ''

Question Number: Q67
Variable Label: Q67. Only nationals trade vs allow foreigners to trade
Question Text: which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2. statement 1: the government should only allow citizens and companies of our own country to trade in consumer goods, even if this means we will have fewer goods or higher prices. statement 2: the government should continue to permit foreigners and foreign corporations to set up retail shops in this country to ensure we have a wide choice of low-cost consumer goods
    Variable Label: ''
    Question Text: ''

Question Number: Q68
Variable Label: Q68. Diverse communities stronger vs similar communities stronger.
Question Text: which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2. statement 1: communities are stronger when they are made up of people from different ethnic group, races, or religions. statement 2: communities are stronger when they are made up of people who are similar to each other, that is, people from the same ethnic group, race, or religion

    Question Text: ''

Question Number: Q73
Variable Label: Q73. Free to move when public security threatened vs impose curfews
Question Text: let’s talk for a moment about the kind of society you would like to have in this country. some people say that, in order to enjoy security from violence in our society, we must limit the amount of freedom that citizens are allowed to enjoy. others say that political liberty is too important to sacrifice and must always be maintained, even if it threatens the security of the country.  which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.  statement 1: even if faced with threats to public security, people should be free to move about the country at any time of day or night.  statement 2: when faced with threats to public security, the government should be able to impose curfews and set up special roadblocks to prevent people from moving around
    Variable Label: ''
    Question Text: ''

Question Number: Q74
Variable Label: Q74.  Government should monitor private communication vs right to privacy.
Question Text: which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.   statement 1: government should be able to monitor private communications, for example on mobile phones, to make sure that people are not plotting violence.  statement 2: people should have the right to communicate in private without a government agency reading or listening to what they are saying
    Variable Label: ''
    Question Text: ''

Question Number: Q75
Variable Label: Q75. Absolute freedom of religion vs government regulates what is said

    Variable Label: ''
    Question Text: ''

Question Number: Q80A_SRL

    Question Text: ''

    Question Text: ''

Question Number: Q80C_SRL
Variable Label: Q80c-SRL. Government should provide free education to all citizens.
Question Text: providing free schooling for all students can help more students to go to school, but it also requires a lot of government resources and can create some challenges. thinking about the future of the free quality school education policy, please tell me whether you agree or disagree with each of the following statements: the government should continue to provide free education for all students even if it leads to an increase in the number of educated citizens who cannot find a job
    Variable Label: ''
    Question Text: ''

Question Number: Q80D_SRL
Variable Label: Q80d-SRL. Free Quality School Education policy should only apply to poor.
Question Text: providing free schooling for all students can help more students to go to school, but it also requires a lot of government resources and can create some challenges. thinking about the future of the free quality school education policy, please tell me whether you agree or disagree with each of the following statements: to save on costs, it would be better if the free quality school education policy only applied to the poor who cannot pay for education, rather than applying to all citizens
    Variable Label: ''
    Question Text: ''

Question Number: Q80E_SRL
Variable Label: Q80e-SRL. Free Quality School Education policy should only apply to pre-primary and primary education.
Question Text: providing free schooling for all students can help more students to go to school, but it also requires a lot of government resources and can create some challenges. thinking about the future of the free quality school education policy, please tell me whether you agree or disagree with each of the following statements: to save on costs, it would be better if the free quality school education policy only applied to pre-primary and primary education and did not include secondary education
    Variable Label: ''
    Question Text: ''

Question Number: Q80F_SRL
Variable Label: Q80f-SRL. Provide free education vs improve quality of education.
Question Text: which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2. do you agree or agree very strongly? statement 1: to make the free education policy a success, the government must invest more resources in education to ensure that all of the necessary schools, materials and teachers are available to provide a good quality education to all students. statement 2: the policy of free education for all students is too expensive; the government should cancel the policy and focus on providing high quality education for those who can afford to pay

    Question Text: ''

Question Number: Q94A
Variable Label: Q94a. Electric connection from national power grid.
Question Text: do you have an electric connection to your home from the electricity distribution and supply agency or edsa
    Variable Label: ''
    Question Text: ''

Variable Label: Q94b. Electricity available from mains.
Question Text: how often is electricity actually available from this connection

Question Text: does your house use electric power from any source other than electricity distribution and supply agency or edsa

Question Text: what is the source of the electricity for this connection

Question Text: is the electricity source owned by your household, or does it come from outside of your household
    Variable Label: ''

Question Number: Q95A
Variable Label: Q95a. Employment status
Question Text: do you have a job that pays a cash income? [if yes, ask] is it full-time or part-time? [if no, ask:] are you presently looking for a job
    Variable Label: ''
    Question Text: ''

Question Number: Q95B
Variable Label: Q95b. Required to pay an income tax
Question Text: if you have paid employment, that is, regular employment for which you receive something like an hourly wage or a regular salary, are you required to pay an income tax, that is, a tax deducted from your wages by your employer
    Variable Label: ''
    Question Text: ''

Variable Label: Q95c. Occupation of respondent
Question Text: what is your main occupation? [if unemployed, retired, or disabled, ask:] what was your last main occupation
    Variable Label: ''
    Question Text: ''

Variable Label: Q95cother. Occupation of respondent (verbatim)
Question Text: what is your main occupation? [if unemployed, retired, or disabled, ask:] what was your last main occupation
    Variable Label: ''
    Question Text: ''

Question Number: Q95D
Variable Label: Q95d. Employer of respondent
Question Text: [if respondent has an occupation, i.e. responses on q95b other than 0=never had a job, 1=student, 2= housewife  or homemaker, ask:] do you work for yourself, for someone else in the private sector or the non-governmental sector, or for government? [if respondent indicated in previous question that they were unemployed, retired or disabled, ask:] in your last job, did you work for yourself, for someone else in the private sector or the non-governmental sector, or for government
    Variable Label: ''
    Question Text: ''

Question Number: Q96A
Variable Label: Q96a. Who decides how money is used?
Question Text: what is the main way that decisions are made about how to use any money that you have or earn, for example from a job, a business, selling things or other activities
    Variable Label: ''
    Question Text: ''

Question Number: Q96B
Variable Label: Head of household
Question Text: who is the head of this household, that is, the person who has primary responsibility for making decisions on behalf of the household
    Variable Label: ''
    Question Text: ''

Question Number: Q96C
Variable Label: Q96c. Occupation of head of household
Question Text: if respondent is not the head of household, i.e. if the response to 96b was not 1=you [respondent] or 99=don’t know, ask:] what is the main occupation of the head of the household? [if unemployed, retired or disabled, ask:] what was his or her last main occupation
    Variable Label: ''
    Question Text: ''

Question Number: withinwt_ea
Variable Label: The weighting variable adjusts the distribution of the sample based on individual selection probabilities (i.e., based on region, gender, urban-rural distribution, and size of household and enumeration area).
Question Text: within country weighting factor, weights to ea level ("old ab withinwt")
    Variable Label: ''
    Question Text: ''
